benchmark_details.name: ALE-Bench (Algorithm Engineering Benchmark)
benchmark_details.overview: ALE-Bench is a benchmark for evaluating AI systems on score-based algorithmic programming contests, particularly focusing on long-horizon optimization problems derived from AtCoder Heuristic Contests. It measures AI performance in algorithm engineering for complex optimization problems in various industrial domains.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate AI systems' long-horizon problem-solving capabilities and algorithm engineering skills on complex optimization tasks through iterative refinement.

data.source: AtCoder Heuristic Contest (AHC) problems collected and licensed for use in the benchmark.
data.size: 40 problems in full version, 10 problems in lite version
data.format: Markdown (for problem statements), Rust (for evaluator programs)

methodology.calculation: Performance metrics are calculated based on aggregate scoring from individual problem evaluations, utilizing normalization and ranking methods similar to those used in human contests.
methodology.interpretation: Higher performance scores indicate better algorithm engineering capabilities as evaluated against human contestants.
methodology.validation: The ALE-Bench results are compared directly against human performance metrics established in previous AHC contests.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: The dataset contains no personal or sensitive data, ensuring confidentiality and compliance with ethical standards.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: All data used in ALE-Bench are licensed by AtCoder for use in the benchmark.
